bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 168, Number 80 (Wednesday, May 11, 2022)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. PLASKETT:H.R. 7726.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8 of the United States Constitution.[Page H4861]

item.title: United States Innovation and Competition Act of 2021

latestAction.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 54.

item.title: Economic Statecraft for the Twenty-First Century Act

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

summary.text:
Inter-American Development Bank General Capital Increase Act of 2022

This bill directs the President to take actions to support a capital increase for the Inter-American Development Bank and authorizes the U.S. governor of the bank to vote in favor of increasing the bank's capital stock.

The bill also requires the Department of the Treasury and U.S. representatives to the bank to support efforts to help countries restructure debts resulting from loans by China's government.

bill.title: Inter-American Development Bank General Capital Increase Act of 2022

item.title: Inter-American Development Bank General Capital Increase Act of 2022
Inter-American Development Bank General Capital Increase Act of 2022
To authorize the tenth general capital increase for the Inter-American Development Bank, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
